The usefulness of Gold is manifold,
Men use it in many ways,
but its misuse comes from intemperate desire.
right-middleGold is useful, though misused by the intemperate desires of Men.

7. Then, for this reason, no color can be
more beautiful than the clear color of gold.
Emperors, Kings and powerful people
Have their Scepters, necklaces, Crowns,
And many ornaments made of Gold.
Borders on cloaks, and cloth of gold,
And clothing shot through with gold threads,
Which King Attalus first applied.
right-middleWhy Gold is of higher worth.
right-middleGold was first used in weaving by Attalus.

8. And Attalus’ work has retained its name.
But in Babylon there was one who invented
embroidery of many colors mingled
with gold threads, which is why
this kind of work is called Babylonian,
Costly, and worth many thousands of pounds.
Indeed, the Emperor Nero paid a million Sesterces
for a wrought garment of this sort.
right-middleA gold border was first invented in Babylon. Joshua 7:21.

9. The Holy Scripture bears witness, without dispute,
to very costly golden Garments,
and how wise Solomon, rich in goods,
arrayed God’s House entirely in pure gold;
even the floor was covered with golden tiles.
In sum, we can well imagine what ravishing,
immeasurable beauty, yes, what wonderful magnificence
that pure golden yellow shining there must have been.
right-middleI Kings 6:22-30. Astonishing beauty of Solomon’s Temple.

10. According to Scripture, Gold
signifies tested faith, strong and active,
with which the Bride of the Lord
is entirely arrayed, just as, likewise,
the bracelets of Rebecca indicate.
For he who was faithful and true
advised a community weakened in faith,
to buy from him Gold purified in the fire.
right-middleWhat gold means in Scripture. Psalm 45:14, Genesis 24:22.

11. There would be much to gloss from the poets,
from the golden branch of Virgil, and the like.
But hear how the Heralds in their emblazoning
Of noble coats of arms explain colors:
this supreme metal indicates one’s wealth,
wisdom, nobility, and generosity,
while they are given new meaning.
according to adjacent colors.
right-middleVirgil’s golden branch indicates wisdom. In the coats of arms of Nobility, Gold indicates wealth, wisdom and generosity.

12. Next to blue, which is its favorite companion,
it signifies, for the wearing of Livery,
right-middleGold next to blue means enjoyment of the world’s pleasure.
